docs.title: Ontology docs
docs.text:
RDF Stream Taxonomy made by pyLODE 2.13.2 RDF Stream Taxonomy Metadata URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology Creator(s) Piotr Sowiński Created 2023-10-22T00:00:00 Issued 2023-10-23T10:51:56 Version Information dev Version URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology/dev Imports http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core License https://spdx.org/licenses/CC-BY-4.0 Ontology RDF RDF (turtle) Description

RDF-STaX enables describing the types of RDF streams and defines relations between them.

Table of Contents
  1. Classes
  2. Object Properties
  3. Annotation Properties
  4. Named Individuals
  5. Namespaces
  6. Legend
Overview Pictures say 1,000 words Figure 1: Ontology overview Classes ↑
  • Abstract RDF stream type
  • Concrete RDF stream type
  • RDF element type
  • RDF stream type
  • RDF stream type usage
Abstract RDF stream typec # Classes URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#AbstractRdfStreamType Description

Class for the abstract RDF stream types in the taxonomy. Instances of this class have abstract definitions, i.e., they cannot be used in practice.

Super-classes RDF stream typec Members stax:flatRdfStream stax:groupedRdfStream stax:rdfStream Concrete RDF stream typec # Classes URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#ConcreteRdfStreamType Description

Class for the concrete RDF stream types in the taxonomy. Instances of this class have concrete definitions, and they can be used in practice.

Super-classes RDF stream typec Restrictions has element typeop some RDF element typec In domain of has element typeop is in stream type semantic relation withop can be flattened intoop can be grouped intoop In range of is in stream type semantic relation withop can be grouped intoop can be flattened intoop uses stream typeop Members stax:rdfGraphStream stax:rdfDatasetStream stax:flatRdfTripleStream stax:timestampedRdfNamedGraphStream stax:rdfSubjectGraphStream stax:rdfNamedGraphStream stax:flatRdfQuadStream RDF element typec # Classes URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#RdfElementType Description

Class for base types of elements in RDF streams. Instances of this class should correspond to RDF "primitives" (e.g., triple, quad, graph, dataset) and should not be further specialized. The instances of this class do NOT form a taxonomical structure.

In range of has element typeop Members stax:dataset stax:graph stax:triple stax:quad RDF stream typec # Classes URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#RdfStreamType Description

Base class for RDF stream types. This class should not be used directly – use instead either stax:AbstractRdfStreamType or stax:ConcreteRdfStreamType.

Super-classes skos:Conceptc Sub-classes Concrete RDF stream typec Abstract RDF stream typec RDF stream type usagec # Classes URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#RdfStreamTypeUsage Description

Class for instances of using an RDF stream type, in a program, an academic paper, or elsewhere. Instances of this class must have the stax:usesStreamType property pointing to a concrete stream type. The stax:usedIn property is also recommended to indicate where the stream is used. The use of other properties (e.g., rdfs:label, rdfs:comment) is encouraged to give more context about the usage.

Note that "stream type usage" is a subjective assertion and instances of this class may be annotated with additional provenance properties to explain who made the assertion. There can be multiple views on what type of stream is in use, depending on the involved actor, processing step, etc.

Restrictions uses stream typeop some Concrete RDF stream typec In domain of used inop uses stream typeop In range of has stream type usageop Object Properties ↑
  • can be flattened into
  • can be grouped into
  • has element type
  • has stream type usage
  • is in stream type semantic relation with
  • used in
  • uses stream type
can be flattened intoop # OPs URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#canBeFlattenedInto Description

Indicates that the subject stream type can be flattened into the object. The flattening is done by enumerating all components of the stream elements in one, flat stream. For example, a graph stream can be flattened into a flat triple stream.

Super-properties is in stream type semantic relation withop Domain(s) Concrete RDF stream typec Range(s) stax:ConcreteRdfStreamTypec can be grouped intoop # OPs URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#canBeGroupedInto Description

Indicates that the subject stream type can be grouped into the object. The grouping is done by splitting the flat stream of statements into groups, which then can be used to construct elements of the grouped stream. For example, a flat triple stream can be grouped into a graph stream.

Super-properties is in stream type semantic relation withop Domain(s) Concrete RDF stream typec Range(s) stax:ConcreteRdfStreamTypec has element typeop # OPs URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#hasElementType Description

For an RDF stream type, indicates the base (primitive) type of elements in the stream (e.g., triple, quad, graph, dataset).

Domain(s) Concrete RDF stream typec Range(s) stax:RdfElementTypec has stream type usageop # OPs URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#hasStreamTypeUsage Description

Inverse of stax:usedIn – indicates that the subject includes a usage of an RDF stream type.

Inverse properties used inop Range(s) stax:RdfStreamTypeUsagec is in stream type semantic relation withop # OPs URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#streamTypeSemanticRelation Description

This property should not be used directly, but as a super-property for all properties denoting a relationship of meaning between RDF stream types.

Super-properties skos:semanticRelation Domain(s) Concrete RDF stream typec Range(s) stax:ConcreteRdfStreamTypec used inop # OPs URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#usedIn Description

For an RDF stream type usage, this property indicates where the stream was used. The value of this property can be for example the DOI URL of an academic work.

Inverse of stax:hasStreamTypeUsage.

Domain(s) RDF stream type usagec uses stream typeop # OPs URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#usesStreamType Description

For an RDF stream type usage, this property indicates which stream type is used.

Domain(s) RDF stream type usagec Range(s) stax:ConcreteRdfStreamTypec Annotation Properties ↑
  • description
  • title
  • created
  • license
  • preferredNamespacePrefix
  • preferredNamespaceUri
  • citation
  • homepage
descriptionap # APs URI http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description titleap # APs URI http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/title createdap # APs URI http://purl.org/dc/terms/created licenseap # APs URI http://purl.org/dc/terms/license preferredNamespacePrefixap # APs URI http://purl.org/vocab/vann/preferredNamespacePrefix preferredNamespaceUriap # APs URI http://purl.org/vocab/vann/preferredNamespaceUri citationap # APs URI http://schema.org/citation homepageap # APs URI http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/homepage Named Individuals ↑
  • Flat RDF quad stream
  • Flat RDF stream
  • Flat RDF triple stream
  • Grouped RDF stream
  • RDF Stream Taxonomy
  • RDF dataset
  • RDF dataset stream
  • RDF graph
  • RDF graph stream
  • RDF named graph stream
  • RDF quad
  • RDF stream
  • RDF subject graph stream
  • RDF triple
  • Timestamped RDF named graph stream
RDF Stream Taxonomyni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology Class(es) skos:ConceptScheme owl:Ontology Description RDF-STaX enables describing the types of RDF streams and defines relations between them. RDF datasetni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#dataset Class(es) stax:RdfElementType Description https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/#section-dataset Flat RDF quad streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#flatRdfQuadStream Class(es) skos:Concept stax:ConcreteRdfStreamType Description A flat RDF quad stream is an RDF stream whose elements are quad statements. Flat RDF streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#flatRdfStream Class(es) stax:AbstractRdfStreamType skos:Concept Description A flat RDF stream is an RDF stream whose elements are statements (either RDF triples or RDF quads). Flat RDF triple streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#flatRdfTripleStream Class(es) skos:Concept stax:ConcreteRdfStreamType Description A flat RDF triple stream is an RDF stream whose elements are triple statements. RDF graphni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#graph Class(es) stax:RdfElementType Description https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/#section-rdf-graph Grouped RDF streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#groupedRdfStream Class(es) stax:AbstractRdfStreamType skos:Concept Description A grouped RDF stream is an RDF stream whose elements are either RDF graphs or RDF datasets. RDF quadni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#quad Class(es) stax:RdfElementType Description An RDF quad is an RDF triple with a fourth component indicating the RDF graph the triple belongs to. If the triple is in a named graph, then the fourth component is the graph name (blank node or IRI). If the triple is in the default graph, then the fourth component is empty. RDF dataset streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#rdfDatasetStream Class(es) skos:Concept stax:ConcreteRdfStreamType Description An RDF dataset stream is a grouped RDF stream whose elements are RDF datasets. RDF graph streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#rdfGraphStream Class(es) skos:Concept stax:ConcreteRdfStreamType Description An RDF graph stream is a grouped RDF stream whose elements are unnamed (default) RDF graphs. RDF named graph streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#rdfNamedGraphStream Class(es) stax:ConcreteRdfStreamType skos:Concept Description An RDF named graph stream is an RDF dataset stream in which every element has exactly one named RDF graph pair , where G is an RDF graph, and n is the graph node. Apart from graph G, the dataset may contain any number of triples in the default graph. RDF streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#rdfStream Class(es) stax:AbstractRdfStreamType skos:Concept Description An RDF stream is an ordered, potentially infinite sequence of RDF stream elements. RDF subject graph streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#rdfSubjectGraphStream Class(es) skos:Concept stax:ConcreteRdfStreamType Description An RDF subject graph stream is an RDF graph stream in which every element contains exactly one unique triple subject. Timestamped RDF named graph streamni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#timestampedRdfNamedGraphStream Class(es) skos:Concept stax:ConcreteRdfStreamType Description A timestamped named graph is an RDF dataset in which: (1) there is exactly one named RDF graph pair , where G is an RDF graph, and n is the graph node; (2) the default graph includes a timestamp triple , where p is a timestamp predicate that relates t, called the timestamp, and the graph G. A timestamped RDF named graph stream is an RDF named graph stream in which every element is a timestamped named graph. The elements that share the same timestamp predicate p are ordered by the partial order associated with p. RDF tripleni URI https://w3id.org/stax/ontology#triple Class(es) stax:RdfElementType Description https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/#section-triples Namespaces ↑ default (stax) https://w3id.org/stax/ontology# brick https://brickschema.org/schema/Brick# csvw http://www.w3.org/ns/csvw# dc http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/ dcam http://purl.org/dc/dcam/ dcat http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat# dcmitype http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/ dcterms http://purl.org/dc/terms/ doap http://usefulinc.com/ns/doap# foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/ geo http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql# odrl http://www.w3.org/ns/odrl/2/ org http://www.w3.org/ns/org# owl http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl# prof http://www.w3.org/ns/dx/prof/ prov http://www.w3.org/ns/prov# qb http://purl.org/linked-data/cube# rdf http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns# rdfs http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema# schema1 http://schema.org/ sdo https://schema.org/ sh http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl# skos http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core# sosa http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/ ssn http://www.w3.org/ns/ssn/ time http://www.w3.org/2006/time# vann http://purl.org/vocab/vann/ void http://rdfs.org/ns/void# wgs https://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/wgs84_pos# xsd http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema# Legend cClasses opObject Properties fpFunctional Properties dpData Properties apAnnotation Properties pProperties niNamed Individuals

docs.title: RDF-STaX uses and publications
docs.text: Are you using RDF-STaX in your project or paper? We would be glad to list it here! Please open an issue with a link or a brief explanation of how you use RDF-STaX.
